intro: Lomatogonium rotatum f. americanum, commonly known as the American lomatogonium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are hairy and lobed, while its flowers are yellow and daisy-like. It is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, contributing to local biodiversity.
